title: Participatory Design Processes for Resilient Communities in Timor-Leste Quiz

questions.question: What is participatory design?
choices: A design approach that actively involves stakeholders in the design process
A design process that excludes community input
A design method used only by professional designers
A design strategy focused on creating high-tech solutions
questions.answer: A design approach that actively involves stakeholders in the design process

questions.question: Participatory design plays a crucial role in community development.
Which of the following is NOT a key principle of participatory design?
Participatory design processes should be iterative and flexible.
Transparency and accountability are important aspects of participatory design.
Which of the following is a participatory design method?
Focus group discussions are a common technique used in participatory design.
What does PRA stand for?
Photovoice is a participatory method that involves:
choices: Participants using photography to document and discuss community issues
Designers creating photo realistic renderings of proposed solutions
Using photos to vote on design options
Analyzing satellite imagery of community landscapes
questions.answer: Participants using photography to document and discuss community issues

questions.question: Design charrettes are intense, multi-day design workshops.
Participatory design can lead to the empowerment of local communities in Timor-Leste.
Participatory processes often result in more sustainable and locally appropriate solutions.
Participatory design can help build social capital and community cohesion.
Community buy-in is not important for the success of participatory design projects.
Participatory design can contribute to the preservation of traditional knowledge and practices.
Which of the following is a challenge in participatory design processes?
choices: Power dynamics and ensuring true representation
questions.answer: Power dynamics and ensuring true representation

questions.question: Time and resource constraints can be a barrier to effective participatory design.
Managing expectations is an important consideration in participatory design processes.
Balancing traditional hierarchies with inclusive participation can be challenging in Timor-Leste.
The case study analysis in this lesson focuses on:
choices: A participatory design project in Timor-Leste
A top-down development project in Indonesia
questions.answer: A participatory design project in Timor-Leste

questions.question: In the hands-on activity, students design a participatory process to address a hypothetical community issue.
Identifying stakeholders to involve is a key step in designing a participatory process.
Choosing appropriate participatory methods is important for the success of the process.
Ensuring inclusivity and managing potential conflicts are not important considerations in participatory design.
Participatory processes can strengthen community capacity and resilience.
There is a connection between participation and adaptive capacity.
Participatory design can play a role in disaster preparedness and climate change adaptation.
The student assignment involves observing or participating in a local community meeting or decision-making process.
The assignment report should include suggestions for improving community engagement.
The main goal of this lesson is to:
choices: Introduce students to participatory design processes and their potential impact in Timor-Leste
Teach students how to design solutions without community input
Discourage the use of participatory methods in development projects
Promote top-down decision-making in community planning
questions.answer: Introduce students to participatory design processes and their potential impact in Timor-Leste
